decision_conditions:
<p>The proposal, by reason of its inclusion of primary living facilities, lack of evidence to demonstrate that the use would be
ancillary and by reason of its independent access from the front curtilage and its capacity to operate as a self contained unit,
would result in an inappropriate use on site which would be detrimental to the character and appearance of the dwelling and
the locality. The proposal would also give rise to inappropriate form of development on garden land. The proposal would
therefore be contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2024), Policies
D3.D(1) and D3.D(11) of The London Plan (2021), Core Policies CS1.A and CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012),
Policy DM1 A., DM1 B. (a), (c) and (d), of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013), the adopted
Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document:
Garden Land Development (2013).
</p>

<p>The proposed development is located within a Critical Drainage Area and insufficient information has been provided on SUDs compliance, or measures to be used or management of surface water and drainage, it has not been demonstrated that the proposed development would not exacerbate the risk of flooding within the site or increase the risk and consequences of flooding elsewhere, contrary to the high-quality design aspirations set out in the ‘National Planning Policy Framework’ (2024), Policies SI12 and SI13 of the ‘London Plan’ (2021), Policies DM9, DM10, DM12 of&nbsp; the ‘Harrow Development Management Policies Plan’ (2013) and Core Policy CS1.U of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012).</p>
description: Detached outbuilding at rear for use  as a granny annex incidental to the main dwelling (Retrospective)
